properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.amazon-s3-client
properties.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.s3.S3Client type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.amazon-s3-presigner
properties.description: An S3 Presigner for Request, used mainly in createDownloadLink operation. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.s3.presigner.S3Presigner type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.auto-create-bucket
properties.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName. This will apply also in case of moveAfterRead option enabled and it will create the destinationBucket if it doesn't exist already.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.autoclose-body
properties.description: If this option is true and includeBody is false, then the S3Object.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to false and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.aws-k-m-s-key-id
properties.description: Define the id of KMS key to use in case KMS is enabled

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.batch-message-number
properties.description: The number of messages composing a batch in streaming upload mode

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.batch-size
properties.description: The batch size (in bytes) in streaming upload mode

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.s3.AWS2S3Configuration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.customer-algorithm
properties.description: Define the customer algorithm to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.customer-key-id
properties.description: Define the id of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.customer-key-m-d5
properties.description: Define the MD5 of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.delete-after-read
properties.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the AWS2S3Constants#BUCKET_NAME and AWS2S3Constants#KEY headers, or only the AWS2S3Constants#KEY header.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.delete-after-write
properties.description: Delete file object after the S3 file has been uploaded

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.delimiter
properties.description: The delimiter which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.destination-bucket
properties.description: Define the destination bucket where an object must be moved when moveAfterRead is set to true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.destination-bucket-prefix
properties.description: Define the destination bucket prefix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.destination-bucket-suffix
properties.description: Define the destination bucket suffix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.done-file-name
properties.description: If provided, Camel will only consume files if a done file exists.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-s3 component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.file-name
properties.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.ignore-body
properties.description: If it is true, the S3 Object Body will be ignored completely, if it is set to false the S3 Object will be put in the body. Setting this to true, will override any behavior defined by includeBody option.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.include-body
properties.description: If it is true, the S3Object exchange will be consumed and put into the body and closed. If false the S3Object stream will be put raw into the body and the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true because the S3Object stream will be consumed then it will also be closed, while in case of includeBody false then it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. However setting autocloseBody to true when includeBody is false it will schedule to close the S3Object stream automatically on exchange completion.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.include-folders
properties.description: If it is true, the folders/directories will be consumed. If it is false, they will be ignored, and Exchanges will not be created for those

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.key-name
properties.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.move-after-read
properties.description: Move objects from S3 bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.multi-part-upload
properties.description: If it is true, camel will upload the file with multi part format, the part size is decided by the option of partSize

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.naming-strategy
properties.description: The naming strategy to use in streaming upload mode

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.operation
properties.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.override-endpoint
properties.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.part-size
properties.description: Setup the partSize which is used in multi part upload, the default size is 25M.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.pojo-request
properties.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.policy
properties.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.prefix
properties.description: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxy-port
properties.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.region
properties.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.restarting-policy
properties.description: The restarting policy to use in streaming upload mode

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.storage-class
properties.description: The storage class to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.PutObjectRequest request.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.streaming-upload-mode
properties.description: When stream mode is true the upload to bucket will be done in streaming

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.streaming-upload-timeout
properties.description: While streaming upload mode is true, this option set the timeout to complete upload

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.uri-endpoint-override
properties.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.use-aws-k-m-s
properties.description: Define if KMS must be used or not

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.use-customer-key
properties.description: Define if Customer Key must be used or not

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.use-default-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.
